title: Known issues with new champ select
body:
Hey all, 

EDIT: Holy cow, what a day. We're back online after having to go down earlier. I've updated the list with some issues, some of which were able to be solved server-side (no patch required). Thanks for the patience.

We’re sharing a list of known issues with new champ select to consolidate feedback and bug reports. Like all other features, we’re taking an iterative approach to new champ select, and will be building on the feature in the months to come. If you see anything outside these issues, post here! We’re planning to fix all of these issues over the next few patches. 

* Unable to purchase skins in new champ select.
* Unable to select chromas in new champ select.
* Unable to select ward skins in new champ select.
* Unable to disable animations in new champ select.
* Champion ability details do not show on mouse hover.
* The “See more stats” button in the Leagues tab of the Profile page has been disabled for both individuals and teams.
* TRIAGE: An issue with MMR-clamping at high-tiers of play was causing exceptionally high queue times. This was improved on 1/14 and again on 1/15 
* SOLVED: An error on our end allowed for an exploit of the tier restriction to be bypassed in Ranked Draft. That has been fully resolved.
* SOLVED: A matchmaking bug caused premade 5's to match against groups of solo players too often. This fix is now implemented
* SOLVED: A matchmaking bug causing lopsided games was solved, expect slightly longer queue times because of this.

Keep an eye on the patch notes and here for updates!

> LOCK IT IN Bans and picks must be locked in. Hovering doesn't count! Failing to lock in a ban or pick will result in a dodge with a time penalty. 

I hope this isn't permanent. Often I like to select my champion and then get some water / go to toilet while the timer runs out and the loading screen starts.

Cant be bothered to add one more click before you leave hunh?

#firstworldproblems

But that's not my point.
My point is that I get ~30 extra seconds to do whatever I have to do if I don't need to lock in.
And waste 30 seconds of other people's time.
Better than being afk for the first 30 seconds of the game no?
How about you do whatever you need to do 30 seconds before you queue for a new game?

My only issue is the banning. Some times I space a bit in chat, trying to talk out what were going to do and didnt realize I was banning... then I get my timer. I kinda wish there was something big, that said "HEY MAN, BRO, YOU'RE BANNING... JUST SAYIN... GL"

Or when you have your volume down and you're on another window waiting for it to find a game, and it finds one. It no longer will 'pop up' and prompt you to accept the game you've found. Had it once or twice where i hadn't even known that it had found one and was given a time i had to wait as punishment. They need to post these changes in a 'newbie help tip' thing or a 'hey, notice: stuff is different' notification when they make substantial changes such as that, and to many other aspects of the new champion selection!!
I would love that. I almost forgot to ban in one game because I didn't even realize I was banning

#firstworldproblems 

lmfao this made my ~~game~~ ahem, day

All jokes aside, you can do whatever you need to do after you lock in, because that means your done, you are free to afk until game starts AFTER YOU LOCK IN. Don't waste your team's time because you need to use the toilet, get a drink, etc... so you hover. 

#wastehertime2016
#wastehistime2016

There *are* legitimate reasons to let the timer run out though. Sometimes your team has problems deciding on particular picks, teamcomp strategy, or maybe even lane/position swaps. It's not always possible to decide beforehand, even for premades, since it could be a response to specific bans or enemy picks. Stalling for a bit more time is pretty reasonable in that case.
Part of the point of that change is specifically to discourage that behavior.
"that behavior" is now part of the game for >6 years. If it truly was a problem Riot would've fixed it by now.
